segments.text: I notice the boy is really stretching to reach those cookies, he must have a sweet tooth.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's standing on that stool like it's nothing, but it looks so dangerous, I can't believe it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe how wobbly it looks, it's like he's about to fall any second, it's terrifying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her cookie, she looks so innocent and patient.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the woman is still drying those dishes, completely unaware of the potential disaster behind her, it's almost like she's ignoring it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the sink, and she doesn't even seem to notice, it's like she's in her own world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the floor must be really slippery by now, someone could get hurt, it's a hazard.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, it's a stark contrast to the scene inside, it's almost jarring.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the boy doesn't fall and hurt himself, it would be such a disaster, I can't even imagine.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is like a time bomb waiting to go off, I can't look away, it's like a train wreck.
segments.speaker: PAR
